intro: Boehmeria guatemalana, commonly known as Guatemalan nettle, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Urticaceae family, which includes various species of stinging nettles. The plant is characterized by its finely toothed leaves and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Boehmeria guatemalana is known for its fibrous stems, which have been used in traditional crafts and textiles.
